qas.question: How many conceptual or physical views of data are there?
How many different external views of data are there?
What is the benefit of external views of data?

answers.text: see database information in a more business-related way

qas.question: How many conceptual or physical views of data do not exist?
How many duplicated external views of data are there?

plausible_answers.text: see database information in a more business-related way

qas.question: What is the disadvantage of external views of data?
Who is not allowed to see database information?

context: While there is typically only <a0_0><b3_0>one<b3_0/><a0_0/> conceptual (or logical) and physical (or internal) view of the data, there can be <a1_0><b4_0>any number<b4_0/><a1_0/> of different external views. This allows <b6_0>users<b6_0/> to <a2_0><b5_0>see database information in a more business-related way<b5_0/><a2_0/> rather than from a technical, processing viewpoint. For example, a financial department of a company needs the payment details of all employees as part of the company's expenses, but does not need details about employees that are the interest of the human resources department. Thus different departments need different views of the company's database.
